s0001.chinese: 秦始皇帝者，秦莊襄王子也。
s0001.literal: The First Emperor of Qin was the son of King Zhuangxiang of Qin.
s0001.idiomatic: The First Emperor of Qin was the son of King Zhuangxiang of Qin.

s0002.chinese: 莊襄王為秦質子於趙，見呂不韋姬，悅而取之，生始皇。
s0002.literal: King Zhuangxiang had been a hostage of Qin in Zhao, where he saw Lü Buwei's concubine, was pleased with her, took her as his own, and she gave birth to the First Emperor.
s0002.idiomatic: King Zhuangxiang had been a hostage of Qin in Zhao, where he saw Lü Buwei's concubine, was pleased with her, took her as his own, and she gave birth to the First Emperor.

s0003.chinese: 以秦昭王四十八年正月生於邯鄲。
s0003.literal: He was born in the first month of the forty-eighth year of King Zhao of Qin at Handan.
s0003.idiomatic: He was born in the first month of the forty-eighth year of King Zhao of Qin at Handan.

s0004.literal: When he was born, he was named Zheng and given the surname Zhao.
s0004.idiomatic: When he was born, he was named Zheng and given the surname Zhao.

s0005.chinese: 年十三歲，莊襄王死，政代立為秦王。
s0005.literal: At the age of thirteen, King Zhuangxiang died, and Zheng succeeded him as King of Qin.
s0005.idiomatic: At the age of thirteen, King Zhuangxiang died, and Zheng succeeded him as King of Qin.

s0006.chinese: 當是之時，秦地已并巴、蜀、漢中，越宛有郢，置南郡矣；
s0006.literal: At that time, Qin's territory had already annexed Ba, Shu, and Hanzhong, passed beyond Wan to possess Ying, and established Nan Commandery;
s0006.idiomatic: At that time, Qin's territory had already annexed Ba, Shu, and Hanzhong, passed beyond Wan to possess Ying, and established Nan Commandery;

s0007.chinese: 北收上郡以東，有河東、太原、上黨郡；
s0007.literal: to the north it had gathered Shangjun and eastward, possessing Hedong, Taiyuan, and Shangdang commanderies;
s0007.idiomatic: to the north it had gathered Shangjun and eastward, possessing Hedong, Taiyuan, and Shangdang commanderies;

s0008.chinese: 東至滎陽，滅二周，置三川郡。
s0008.literal: to the east it reached Xingyang, destroyed the Two Zhous, and established Sanchuan Commandery.
s0008.idiomatic: to the east it reached Xingyang, destroyed the Two Zhous, and established Sanchuan Commandery.

s0009.chinese: 呂不韋為相，封十萬戶，號曰文信侯。
s0009.literal: Lü Buwei served as prime minister, was enfeoffed with one hundred thousand households, and titled Marquis Wenxin.
s0009.idiomatic: Lü Buwei served as prime minister, was enfeoffed with one hundred thousand households, and titled Marquis Wenxin.

s0010.chinese: 招致賓客游士，欲以并天下。
s0010.literal: He attracted guests and traveling scholars, intending to unify all under Heaven.
s0010.idiomatic: He attracted guests and traveling scholars, intending to unify all under Heaven.

s0011.literal: Li Si served as a retainer.
s0011.idiomatic: Li Si served as a retainer.

s0012.chinese: 蒙驁、王齮、麃公等為將軍。
s0012.literal: Meng Ao, Wang He, and Biao Gong served as generals.
s0012.idiomatic: Meng Ao, Wang He, and Biao Gong served as generals.

s0013.chinese: 王年少，初即位，委國事大臣。
s0013.literal: The king was young and had just ascended the throne, so he entrusted state affairs to the great ministers.
s0013.idiomatic: The king was young and had just ascended the throne, so he entrusted state affairs to the great ministers.

s0014.chinese: 晉陽反，元年，將軍蒙驁擊定之。
s0014.literal: Jinyang rebelled; in the first year, General Meng Ao attacked and pacified it.
s0014.idiomatic: Jinyang rebelled; in the first year, General Meng Ao attacked and pacified it.

s0015.chinese: 二年，麃公將卒攻卷，斬首三萬。
s0015.literal: In the second year, Biao Gong led troops to attack Juan, beheading thirty thousand.
s0015.idiomatic: In the second year, Biao Gong led troops to attack Juan, beheading thirty thousand.

s0016.chinese: 三年，蒙驁攻韓，取十三城。
s0016.literal: In the third year, Meng Ao attacked Han and took thirteen cities.
s0016.idiomatic: In the third year, Meng Ao attacked Han and took thirteen cities.

s0018.chinese: 十月，將軍蒙驁攻魏氏暢、有詭。
s0018.literal: In the tenth month, General Meng Ao attacked Chang and Yougui of Wei.
s0018.idiomatic: In the tenth month, General Meng Ao attacked Chang and Yougui of Wei.

s0019.literal: There was a great famine that year.
s0019.idiomatic: There was a great famine that year.

s0020.literal: In the fourth year, they captured Chang and Yougui.
s0020.idiomatic: In the fourth year, they captured Chang and Yougui.
